docs.snippet: Convinced that existing difficulties threaten success of the seventh Pan-American Conference in Montevideo in December, export executives last week were outspoken in their demands that the gathering be postponed until the meeting can be held under...
docs.lead_paragraph: Convinced that existing difficulties threaten success of the seventh Pan-American Conference in Montevideo in December, export executives last week were outspoken in their demands that the gathering be postponed until the meeting can be held under more propitious circumstances.
docs.abstract: Gets lr from G F Bauer, who urges postponemen of Pan Amer Conf

headline.main: WOULD POSTPONE TRADE CONFERENCE; Exporters Contend Montevideo Meeting Has Slim Chance for Success. BAUER APPEALS TO HULL Asks Tariff and Money Policies Be Settled First -- Threat Seen in Cuban Loan Probe.

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Oct. 28. -- Norman H. Davis, American Ambassador-at-Large, called on Ambassador Naotake Sato of Japan today to return his call and, it is understood, to express the hope that M. Sato's statement to the bureau of the conference yesterday did...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Oct. 28. -- Norman H. Davis, American Ambassador-at-Large, called on Ambassador Naotake Sato of Japan today to return his call and, it is understood, to express the hope that M. Sato's statement to the bureau of the conference yesterday did not mean Japan was withdrawing from the Disarmament Conference.

headline.main: JAPAN WILL STAY IN ARMS PARLEY; Sato Tells Davis Its View That Task Is Europe's Does Not Mean Withdrawal. TO TAKE A PASSIVE PART League of Nations Asked to Send Delegate to Pan-American Congress at Montevideo.

docs.snippet: Default in interest on sixteen foreign bond issues was announced yesterday, of which fourteen were of German bonds and two of Uruguayan obligations. The New York Stock Exchange ruled that seven German and the two Uruguayan bonds shall be dealt in...
docs.lead_paragraph: Default in interest on sixteen foreign bond issues was announced yesterday, of which fourteen were of German bonds and two of Uruguayan obligations. The New York Stock Exchange ruled that seven German and the two Uruguayan bonds shall be dealt in flat, while the New York Curb Exchange ruling affected the seven other German bonds.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 -- Secretary Hull was unanimously re-elected today chairman of the governing board of the Pan American Union. The Secretary of State of the United States has always held this post.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 -- Secretary Hull was unanimously re-elected today chairman of the governing board of the Pan American Union. The Secretary of State of the United States has always held this post.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 -- United States exports in September, valued at $160,089,996, were larger to all the so-called grand divisions except Oceania, and exceeded those of the preceding month to thirty-two of the forty principal foreign markets,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 -- United States exports in September, valued at $160,089,996, were larger to all the so-called grand divisions except Oceania, and exceeded those of the preceding month to thirty-two of the forty principal foreign markets, according to detailed foreign trade figures made public today by the Department of Commerce.

headline.main: OUR EXPORTS ROSE TO SIX CHIEF AREAS; Only Oceania Did Not Take Part in the $28,638,904 September Upturn.
